summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Queen Margot [VHS] Review Date: 2015/04/20 Store: Rated: Unrated Format: VHS Tape Categories: Movies & TV, Art House & International, By Country, France Product Description: ['Product Description', "A classic tale of intrigue and forbidden love, QUEEN MARGOT is the powerful hit universally acclaimed by critics! Thrown into a political marriage of convenience by her ruthlessly power-hungry family, the beautiful Margot (Isabelle Adjani -- CAMILLE CLAUDEL) soon finds herself hopelessly drawn into their murderous affairs. It's then she realizes that her only hope of escape lies somewhere between the heroic soldier who loves her and the enemy husband who could save her! Triumphant winner of 5 Cesar Awards the pretigious Cannes Film Festival Jury Prize -- you're sure to be entertained by this vivid portrayal of passion, revenge, and extraordinary courage!", 'Amazon.com', 'Based on a novel by Alexandre Dumas,', 'Queen Margot', "concerns the events behind infamous Massacre of St. Bartholomew in 16th-century France. Isabelle Adjani plays Margot, betrothed for political reasons to one man (Daniel Auteuil) by her mother (Virna Lisi), while she is, in fact, in love with another (Vincent Pérez). Despite the bond that grows between the reluctant couple, plots are hatching all over the castle against the royals. Adventurous, exciting, erotic, and given strong artistic credibility through its outstanding cast, the film is enthralling and visually sumptuous. Directed by Patrice Chereau, less known outside of France than is the film's producer, Claude Berri (director of", 'Jean de Florette', 'and', 'Manon of the Spring', ').', '--Tom Keogh'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Format': 'Color, Dolby, Subtitled, NTSC, HiFi Sound', 'Contributor': 'Adjani, Anglade, Auteuil', 'Language': 'Russian', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.13 Ounces', 'Release date': 'April 30, 1996', 'Date First Available': 'September 29, 2006', 'Actors': 'Adjani, Auteuil, Anglade', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Miramax', 'Country of Origin': 'USA'} Review Text: Not the Queen Margot I expected. It had subtitles and a different plot. Review Title: One Star Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/04/20 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Christian J. Pinto'], 'Producers': ['Adullam Films'], 'Starring': ['Chris Pinto', 'Ed Decker'], 'Studio': ['Total Content Digital']} Review Text: Christian propaganda and prejudice Review Title: One Star Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/04/20 Average Rating: 3.1 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Goh Choon Ean'], 'Producers': ['Goh Choon Ean'], 'Starring': ['Tan Siao Ping', 'Wendy Lim', 'Susanna Leung'], 'Studio': ['Vision Video']} Review Text: Excellent overview of Chinese history followed by Christian propaganda Review Title: Four Stars Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/04/20 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Paul Giamatti', 'Laura Linney', 'Stephen Dilane'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: rewatching because it is so good Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/04/20 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Israel Horovitz'], 'Producers': ['Rachael Horovitz', 'Gary Foster', 'Nitsa Benchetrit', 'David C. Barrot'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Kline', 'Kristin Scott Thomas', 'Maggie Smith']} Review Text: effects of adultery on children told late in life Review Title: Four Stars Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/01/15 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bruce Beresford'], 'Producers': ['David Buelow', 'Mark Canton', 'Lee Nelson', 'Courtney Solomon'], 'Starring': ['Eddie Murphy', 'Britt Robertson', 'Natascha McElhone'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']} Review Text: inspiring Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/01/28 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mick Jackson'], 'Producers': ['Scott Ferguson', 'Emily Gerson Saines', 'Gil Bellows', 'Alison Owen', 'Paul Lister', 'Anthony Edwards', 'Dante Di Loreto'], 'Starring': ['Claire Danes', "Catherine O'Hara", 'Julia Ormond'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: The TV version was better, but I appreciate being reminded of how other people can think. Review Title: Four Stars Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/01/03 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Scott Cooper'], 'Producers': ['John Lesher', 'Ken Kao', 'Scott Cooper'], 'Starring': ['Christian Bale', 'Rosamund Pike', 'Wes Studi'], 'Studio': ['ENTERTAINMENT STUDIOS']} Review Text: I got this because I know one of the actors and some of the local history. Review Title: enjoyable Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: I, Claudius (35th Anniversary Edition) Review Date: 2019/01/03 Store: Sian Phillips (Actor), Derek Jacobi (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama Product Description: ['"A true masterpiece" —', 'San Francisco Chronicle', '"Fiendishly sophisticated" —', 'The New York Times', '"Handsomely produced, grandly acted, and…thoroughly involving" —', 'The Washington Post', '"Irresistible, witty" —', 'Los Angeles Times', 'Rated one of the "100 Best TV Shows of All Time" by Time magazine, this epic BBC series spans the history of the Roman Empire from Augustus through Claudius, a stuttering scholar who learns early to play the fool and stay alive. Based on the novels by Robert Graves, it stars Derek Jacobi (', 'The King’s Speech', ',', 'Cadfael', ') in a career-defining role. Siân Phillips (', 'The Age of Innocence', ') is “exquisitely wicked” (Los Angeles Times) as the lethal Livia, wife to Augustus (Brian Blessed,', 'Hamlet', '), while John Hurt (', 'The Elephant Man', ') is "decadence personified" (', 'USA Today', ') as the depraved Caligula, whose reign of terror paves the way for Claudius’s ascension.', 'Winner of an Emmy® and numerous other awards, this riveting tale of ambition, debauchery, and intrigue remains one of the most popular and acclaimed dramas in Masterpiece Theatre history. Patrick Stewart (', 'X-Men', '), George Baker (', 'The Ruth Rendell Mysteries', '), Margaret Tyzack (', 'Cousin Bette', '), and James Faulkner (', 'The Bank Job', ') also star.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama/Television, Television/British Television', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Patrick Stewart, John Hurt, Sian Phillips, Derek Jacobi', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 4.64 Ounces', 'Item model number': '8750', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '11 hours and 8 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 5, 2012', 'Actors': 'Sian Phillips, Derek Jacobi, Patrick Stewart, John Hurt', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '5'} Review Text: Films are made for a particular time. This is very good, but of more interest to historians. Review Title: Time has made less relevant Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Shape of Water Review Date: 2019/01/03 Categories: Suspense, Drama, Fantastic, Tense Product Description: ["From master storyteller Guillermo del Toro comes an otherworldly fairy tale set in 1960s America where a woman's life is changed forever after she discovers a secret experiment."] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Guillermo Del Toro'], 'Producers': ['Guillermo del Toro', 'J. Miles Dale'], 'Starring': ['Sally Hawkins', 'Michael Shannon', 'Richard Jenkins']} Review Text: We both enjoyed it. Review Title: thought-provoking. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/01/03 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Martin McDonagh'], 'Producers': ['Graham Broadbent', 'Pete Czernin', 'Martin McDonagh'], 'Starring': ['Frances McDormand', 'Woody Harrelson', 'Sam Rockwell'], 'Studio': ['Searchlight']} Review Text: A good movie for adults
that is not just thoughtless entertainment Review Title: Deserves rating Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has shown a preference for engaging and thought-provoking narratives, particularly enjoying films with strong character development and rich storytelling. High ratings have been awarded for content that inspires, entertains, and offers deep insights, especially regarding societal issues and human emotions. The appreciation for well-crafted dramatic presentations and intriguing plots is evident, reflecting a love for artistic films that provoke intellectual discourse. The user has positively noted several titles as enjoyable, reaffirming their affinity for compelling cinema that resonates on multiple levels.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
Despite positive experiences, the user has encountered notable dissatisfaction with certain purchases, particularly those perceived as politically charged or laden with unwanted religious messages. This negative sentiment was voiced through low ratings and critiques highlighting misleading content and misaligned expectations. Specific frustrations stem from being confronted with out-of-place themes, incongruent plots, and a lack of engaging storytelling. These instances have contributed to a perception of poor quality in some acquisitions, leading to an overall disappointing experience with those titles.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's shopping behavior reveals a strong inclination towards high-quality cinema that can inspire and engage. Positive experiences often stem from carefully curated selections showcasing emotional depth and artistry. However, the user has also faced challenges with a few purchases, particularly when the content diverged from desired themes or included unwanted elements, resulting in frustration. Balancing the appreciation for impactful storytelling with occasional disappointments highlights the complexity of their viewing preferences, showcasing the importance of aligning expectations with product offerings.
